text:
Simple Logging Facade for Java (SLF4J, http://www.slf4j.org) is a continuation of the former UGLI effort 
within log4j.

When SLF4J was spun out of Apache, the log4j build was modified to fetch the current SLF4J source by 
invoking a 3rd party Java class (org.tmatesoft.svn.cli.SVN).  This approach: required locating the SVN 
class, did not allow reproducable builds, and was unlike any other library required for log4j.

This modification will allow log4j to be build with integrated an SLF4J implementation or without and 
uses any .jar file (typically slf4j-nop.jar) from an SLF4J release to provide the SLF4J class definitions.  

To build with an SLF4J implementation, specify -Dslf4j=true -Dslf4j-api.jar=slf4j-1.0-beta2/slf4j-
nop.jar on the command line or the equivalent in build.properties.  The org.slf4j.ULogger interface will 
be extracted from the source SLF4J jar and placed in the log4j.jar file.

To build without, omit specify -Dslf4j=false or omit it.

Log4j had referenced org.slf4j.impl.MessageFormatter and other SLF4J implementation classes to reuse 
functionality that had no relation to the SLF4J factory pattern.  These classes were resurrected from the 
UGLI code base and moved to org.apache.log4j.helpers.MessageFormatter, 
org.apache.log4j.spi.NOPULogger and org.apache.log4j.spi.SimpleULogger.

The previous UGLI tests have been resurrected but only test the log4j implementation, to run the tests

cd tests
ant -f ugli-test.xml runAll

The UGLI names were retained to maintain the version history, but may be renamed after the expected 
migration to Subversion.

The definition of org.apache.log4j.ULogger differs between SLF4J and non-SLF4J builds and the SLF4J 
build contains an implementation of org.slf4j.LoggerFactory.  The build.core task will either compile the 
files in the src/slf4j or src/no-slf4j directory depending on the value of the slf4j property.
creator: carnold@apache.org

Created attachment 15930
Changes to make CVS HEAD compatible with slf4j-1.0-beta4

SLF4J-1.0-beta4 changes signatures in a way that could be problematic if
implemented directly.  This patch will make the CVS HEAD as of 5 Aug 2005
compatible with slf4j-1.0-beta4 but should not be committed without discussion
and vote.
creator: carnold@apache.org
